body:
Seems like this discussion is related: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/discussions/1733#discussioncomment-5183166

Though it also seems that suggestion requires a much larger change.

issue.title: Operator Controller Release

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

repository.name: operator-controller
repository.description: A new and improved management framework for extending Kubernetes with Operators

issue.body:
Adds a release github action and implements goreleaser, borrowing heavily from rukpak but stripped down a bit.

See my fork here for an example release output: https://github.com/dtfranz/operator-controller/releases/tag/v0.0.2

Some of the additional build targets found in rukpak have been stripped out to keep this smaller.

Addresses #132 and #109

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.title: Make build.skip template-able
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I have a goreleaser setup that build for regular crypto and another build for fips crypto.
We are doing multi-arch multi os build.
I would like to skip the build of fips crypto unless it's a tagged version (ie: a release)

### Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to be able to use `build.skip` with conditionals like for instance `skip: {{ empty .Tag }}` 

Like it [has been done](https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/3828) for `changelog.skip`, for instance.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

FTM, I need to build using other mean (like GH action) in order to avoid dual build

### Search

- [X] I did search for other open and closed issues before opening this

### Supporter

- [ ] I am a [sponsor](https://github.com/sponsors/caarlos0/) or a [Pro](https://goreleaser.com/pro) customer

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Additional context

_No response_
